author: jgm
content:
Not really apropos of anything, but here is a distribution of gas usage for the deposit contract on Topaz (successful direct transactions only).

Main takeaway is that a "safe" gas limit is north of 400,000; 450,000 seems reasonable (or 500,000 if you want to be sure).

author: djrtwo
content: Yeah, the iterative merkle tree in the contract provides huge gas savings (across the board) but at the cost of being highly variable

author: jgm
content: I did find it cool that you can so clearly see the steps (those frequencies are literally 50%, 25%, 12.5%, ~6.28%, after which the fixed costs start to ruin it)
